radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of bowel obstruction or perforation
Enlargement of head and body of the pancreas; slight stranding and inflammatory changes in the fat around the body and tail of the pancreas; no dilatation of pancreatic duct or common bile duct

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Upper gastrointestinal series with small-bowel examination

radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse attenuation of the common bile duct; smooth stricture, 3 mm in length, in distal third of the duct; possible stricture at the origin of the left hepatic duct; pancreatic duct not optimally visualized
Resolution of stricture in common bile duct; diffuse irregularity in duct in pancreatic head; complete obstruction of main pancreatic duct
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Stricture that had been seen in distal third of common bile duct appeared to have resolved

radiographic_examinations.findings: Lungs and heart normal; unfolding of the descending thoracic aorta
Parenchymal abnormalities suggestive of inflammatory or malignant infiltration
Specimen contained benign acini, few ducts; thick bands of dense collagen; little inflammation; no malignant cells
